text: Tap at Lambiczoon, 4th May 17. Pours clean and clear, with a big bubbly white head. Aroma is fresh grass, light citrus. Taste is clean, grass, bitter and sweet, light and refreshing. Excellent.
Tap at Bir&Fud. Hazy gold with tall, fluffy head. Lemony nose, light malt, spicy hops. Grainy, crisp, hoppy. Great hops: peppery, light lemon, very prickly finish. Awesome kolsch.

Draught @ Lambiczoon, Milan. Pours light golden with a creamy white head. Aroma of malt, light bread, grassy hops, flowers. Flavor is malt, little sweet, bread, grass, flowers. Medium body, average carbonation, light bitter finish. 121215

At Eurhop 2015 in Rome - Italy, on tap. Finally. Pours a pale golden hazy color, tick white creamy cap. Nose: straw-hay, milled malt, flour, some bread, grass too. Mild but with character. Mouth: soft carbonation, great malty body despite its low abv, malts, bitter elegant finish. Bravissimi!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Spina @ Scurreria beer & bagel.
Chiara con bella schiuma.
Bella erbosa e secca, fieno
Im sorry ... The beer is very good but its not a kolsch .. A bunch of herbs in your mouth .. When I was in cologne never had a kolsch so good ..
Bue à la pression. Couleur blonde, fine mousse blanche. Intéressante pour le style. Notes maltées et citronnées en finale. Correcte.
Tap @ Baladin, Roma. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are grass, straw, hops and little malt. Nice bitter dry finish.
Bue à la pression en 50cl, couleur dorée, grosse mousse et effervescence bien présente, une bière assez intense au nez ça sent le foin en bouche maltée sur le grain et le pain pas formidable.
Pale golden clear, cream white head. Carbonated, cereal and light citrus aroma. Light taste with remarkable bitterness at the end and in the aftertaste.

Draft @ Lambiczoon, Milano. Grazie a te Nino.
Dorée, léger trouble paille, col épais blanc crémeux.
Arôme de grains, malté, rappel de maïs laissant une petite douceur olfactive. Houblonné reste dans un style noble allemand léger fleuri et citronné.
Palais légèrement houblonné noble, pointe citronnée palais malté rappelant le côté pilsner au relent de pale ale. Amertume est modérée avec un petit côté vert frais-fleuri sur la fin. Pour un style qui nest pas spécialement mon préféré, cette bière est agréablement surprenante.

Bottle @ birreria del porco. Schiuma bianca abbastanza fine abbastanza persistente. profumo abbastanza intenso poco persistente fruttato, tendente allagrumato, note di uva bianca e quasi vinose. Luppolo erbaceo. Gusto intenso, poco persistente. Dolce abboccato, lievemente acidulo, poco amaro. Si avvertono un gusto quasi vinoso, dei cereali e un amaro da luppolo non invadente. é una birra equilibrata, armonica e molto beverina
Aroma is yeast, very slight citrus and perfumed. The flavor is light citrus, grainy malts, slight sweetness and a medium tart finish.

Una buona kolsch dorata, schiuma bianca abbondante e lievemente opalescente. Più amara rispetto alla tradizionale,si percepisce il maltato allinizio e viene fuori lerbaceo del luppolo sul finale. Molto beverina.

15/01/2013 La Tana (tap). Giallo scarico, lievemente torbida, schiuma biancastra, abbondante e abbastanza persistente. Naso delicato ma gradevolissimo. Sentori citrici, di limone, preponderanti, leggero erbaceo, lieviti. In bocca è un miracolo assoluto di equilibrio e beverinità, attacco leggermente maltato, quindi amaro deciso ma mai invasivo e una puntina acidula sul finale che lascia la bocca pulita. Corpo medio-basso, carbonazione buona. Birra fantastica, non ci si stanca mai di berla.

Pours pale yellow, murky and cloudy with yeast particles and a large white head.  Nose is sweet corn syrup, sweet rolls, light grass and some stewed cabbage smell.  Taste is dull and watered down at first but then gets better toward the end with some nice bittersweetness.  Mouthfeel is clean and soft, light body and has a long finish.
Herbal and citrus aroma, taste is light bitter. Drinkable with long finish.
pale yellow, cloudy. foam thin and compact. Sliding. Intense aroma. original recipe, hoppy, nicely acidic. Cool and refreshing
Aroma is grassy and citrusy, appearance is clear and pale, with a frothy white head. Taste is quite dry and bitter, much more than the German "original", with very low carbonation. An excellent beer!
Greeny yellow body with a small off-white head. Aroma is citrus, grapefruit. Taste is sour, with some grassy and hoppy note.
Una birra che ha nella beverinità la sua carta vincente. Attacco maltato poi arriva il luppolato e una chiusura che lascia la bocca pronta al sorso successivo. La scarsa carbonazione aiuta la beva.

Aroma: light, fresh, malt and hops
Appearance: golden
Taste: moderate sweet and bitter
palate: medium
Overall: another masterpiece froom bi-du
On tap at BQ Navigli, Milano. Pale golden, frothy head. Fruity aroma with notes of grapes. More grape fflavours, still quite dry. Pretty good.

Draft @ Karhisma Birroteca (Piedimonte Matese, Caserta - Italy). Intense hazy golden color, stately big white head. Yeasty and acidic aroma with citrus notes, slightly hoppy. Light body but no watery, really refreshing, invites you to drink a bucket of. Lemon syrup, lime, herbaceous tone, dry finish. Really good summer beer.
Spina. Colore giallo scarico. Forte sentori di lievito al naso che disturbano un po. In bocca però è equilibrata. Amaro finale gradevole. Peccato il pessimo impatto
Bevuta alla spina si presenta di colorgiallo chiaro leggermete torbido, profumi erbacei, in bocca risulta essere molto luppolata il che la sbilancia un pò sullamaro.

Colore dorato-arancio con fine schiuma bianca persistente. Buona anche limpressione al naso, dove un bel floreale delicato con sentori mielosi ci invitano allassaggio. In bocca invece è meravigliosa, rinfrescante, equilibrata, pulita, morbida, secca e ben luppolata. Sullo stile non sono un grande esperto avendo assaggiato poche birre di Colonia, ma questa la trovo splendida. Da bere a ettolitri

Very summery fresh beer. Light carbonation, blond and transparent appearance and very clear, Ive drunk this beer on tap in a small glass (unique size). Thats because of the easiness to increase its temperature in summer time and because of its proper glass which has a very thin border. Its low alcoholic graduation is also very indicated for the summer season.
UPDATED: JAN 13, 2012 Very drinkable beer with pleasant and fresh aroma, great taste. Had it at Open Rome
floreal and hop aroma! Dry and tangy taste just right, a perfect beer!!!

On draught at Open Baladin Rome. pour a hazy dense gold color. Lasting white lace and head with fine bubbles. Light body. Lots of fermentation notes-berry character, subtle fruitness, no crispness or hop bitterness present. Too non-traditional for me.
consiglio a tutti quelli che amano la birra estiva fresca beverina e molto dissetante, questa birra! datemene ancora!
una buona kolsh! i profumi sono discreti di luppolo e malto, ottima schiuma, un po troppo velata, ma il gusto è piacevole e ti viene voglia di riberla.

Draft. An unclear light golden beer with a white head. The aroma has notes of wheat as well as lighter notes of coriander. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt and wheat as well as lighter notes of coriander and orangepeal, leading to a dry wheaty finish. Boring.
IBF 2010. Una birra in stile klosch veramente ben fatta, beverina, con il luppolo in grande risalto. Da grande bevuta!

From tap at Open Baladin. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is fruity and slight yeasty. Bitter, citrusy and mild fruity flavoured. Rather phenolic and dry into the finish with a lasting phenolic and bitter hops mix.

On tap. RBESG Rome 2010. Pours a cloudy yellow with a white lacing head. Very fruty with orange accents. Light-bodied with very dry fruit - oranges and other citrusy fruits. Dry and astringent finish. 050610
Slightly hazy golden with a lasting, white head. Clean malty aroma of fresh grain. Sweetish, clean malt flavour with a touch of hops in the finish
On tap at Open Baladin. Clear golden with a medium white head. The aroma is light hoppy with some fruity notes as well as caramel. Clean flavour of fruit, caramel and light hops.
5th June 2010 - Draft at Open Baladin. Hazy amber beer. Little white head. Crisp semi dry palate. Dry maly but well balanced with some well behaved orange hop. A little over dry but okay.
Draught @ Open Baladin, Rome. Pours unclear yellow with a small creamy white head and lacings. Nose is grain, hay and mild yeast. Very grassy flavor with a touch of diacetyl. Medium bodied.

On tap at Open Baladin, RBESG Rome day 3. Hazy golden yellow colour, white head. Earthy hoppy aroma with some light grainy malts. Flavour is dry, light sweet, earthy liquorice root finish. Light bodied. Nice flavours.
Birra in stile Colonia, con un luppolo tedesco un pò troppo prepotente che copre ogni altro sapore. Non è male, ma potrebbe essere meglio
Draught at Open Baladin. Clear yellow - white head. Light bitterness. White bread. Soapy. A light bitterness. Light honey sweetness.
La birra dissetante per eccellenza. Fresca, luppolosa, estiva. Un capolavoro o quasi.

Draught @ BQ - Birra artigianale di Qualita, Via Losanna 36, 20100 Milano, Italy.Clear medium yellow color with a small to average, frothy - fizzy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, white to off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted, moderate hoppy, citrus, soap, coriander notes. Flavor is moderate sweet and bitter with a average duration. Body is medium, texture is watery to oily, carbonation is soft. [20091108]

olfatto floreale e luppolo.gusto fresca secca equilibrata e beverina 
molto buona

0.75l bottle, courtesy of Allen - thank you very much indeed! Hazy golden colour, mid-sized white head. Hoppy aroma with lots of citrus fruit. Light to medium-bodied, malty background with bitter and aromatic hops. Flavours of lime and lemon, slightly herbal with a touch of mint. Lingering hoppy finish with a lovely citrus character. A delicious beer. Herzlichen Dank, Allen!

Sampled at the brew pub. It pours a hazy golden beer with a small creamy white head. Wonderfully hoppy taste with hints of tropical fruits. Some coconut and wild strawberries sneaking in. Beautiful lacework. Deeply refreshing. Light bodied. Good bitterness. Long dry hoppy finish. A great beer. Absolutely fantastic!

ottimo esempio di stile!
beverina e di personalità
amara e secca, da bere a secchi.

Great example of a tasteful, highly drinkable but absolutely not ordinary beer.Crisp palate, long finish. A bottled version was even hoppier, more intense, excellent (rating of 4/5) though maybe less true to style.

courtesy of fiulijn - hazy golden colour with a firm white head; crisp aroma of malt and peanuts; good and rounded malt body; decent bitterness and a long grassy, malty and hazelnutty finish - not really complex but terribly efficient

UPDATED: JUN 25, 2008 Prima kolsch assaggiata, grazie a Wiggs (il birraio della celeberrima Kezzyer) bottiglia da 75cl. Versa colore biondo trasparente con un po di torbidezza data dal lievito ma comunque buona schiuma pirla che leggi. Aroma molto erbaceo, sapore ancora di più con toni di lavanda (??) un po troppo predominanti. Però buona un po difficile da berne quintali.

Considering the style, Scores ranging from 1 to 5, 5 being the most intense

Comments: Draught, Hop, Milano. Now thats something quite interesting. Considered a Kölsch, yet pushing the boundaries from the style further. A special and very malty beer. Initially sweet, but quickly switches over to a long, strongly hoppy, vibrantly bitter and snappy finish. Great, clean, yet almost farmy nature.
UPDATED: MAY 18, 2008 chiaro buona schiuma non molto persistente gasata molto lieve note floreali leggero luppolo ben bilanciata davvero molto bevibile buon finale amaro

UPDATED: OCT 22, 2007 Bottle. Hazy golden yellow beer. The head is quite vanishing. A great balance between honey bready fresh malty notes and a fantastic grassy hoppiness. The end is dry, crisp and leaves you with plenty of pleasant hops bitter aftertaste...and the strong desire to have another one.

Draught  Fully hazy yellow-golden beer; thick, persistent white head. Fresh malt, bit of grass, lots of maltsugars too, going to sweet-ish. Nearly tart onset, lots of grass, but a soft, vanilla-like flavour underneath, traces of ureum, traces of pineapple- and bananaesters, always mingled with fresh hops. Light MF, lots of grist slickness, creamy, near velvety. Qutie good, artisanal "Kölsch". Nothing outstanding, but more than decent. Lots of Pilsener notes, more hops than in any Kölner Kölsch.
Extremely crisp and refreshing Kolsch.  So far Bi-Du is 2/2 for me.  Nice use of hops keeps this beer fresh and lively -- a pleasure to drink.  Im looking forward to more from this fine brewery.

UPDATED: SEP 13, 2007 Draught at "Salone della Birra Artigianale 2006" - Milan. 
Yellow straw-like in color, lightly hazy(apparently dirty) and with a good and frothy head; little bubbly one. Much chilly scent, extremely hoppines and acidulous. Enough pungent taste and with pleasant notes of withered clear grape and sour plum. Moderate and pleasant alcohol tone. Much representative of this style.

UPDATED: DEC 27, 2005 Draught at the brewpub, 2005-12-26, 8-5-7-4-15=39Hazy blond color; thick yoghurt-like head. Nice hoppy aroma (Hallertau) and light malt. The malt profile is quite low, its quite dry and smooth at the same time, it has a wonderful hopping. The palate is aromatic, good, not extremely strong.Draught at the brewpub, 2002-11-10, 6-5-6-4-14=35Light aroma, some hop.Dry, good hop but lacking a better malt character. Maybe too long infusion for the hop.Draught at the brewpub, 2002-09-09, 9-5-7-4-15=40Blond, cloudy; creamy, thick head. Wonderful aroma of fresh hop flowers (hop cones), intense. Dry in the front, then smoother, some malt and malt sweetness, strong hop character; too much yeast. Good palate, with some residual sweetness and a very long bitterness, same style as the aroma. Strict, one-way, peculiar but enjoyable.
